analyzed: graha nakṣatra tārāḥ ca dakṣa ādyān ca prajāpatīn
translated: the planets, stars, and constellations, and the Prajāpatis beginning with Dakṣa,

analyzed: saṃpaśyan vismaya āviṣṭaḥ prakṛti sthaḥ kṣaṇāt punar
translated: seeing all this, filled with wonder, he was instantly restored to his normal state.

original: prahlādaḥ prāha daityendraṃ baliṃ vairociniṃ tataḥ // / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ prāha daitya indram balim vairocinim tatas
translated: Prahlada then spoke to Bali, the lord of the Daityas, the son of Virochana,

analyzed: tat saṃjñātam mayā sarvam yad artham bhavatām iyam

analyzed: tejasaḥ hāniḥ utpannā śṛṇvantu tat aśeṣatas
translated: Let the loss of splendour that has taken place be heard in full.
The god of gods, the source of the world, unborn, the first-born of the world,

analyzed: anādiḥ ādiḥ viśvasya vareṇyaḥ vara daḥ hariḥ
translated: The beginningless beginning of the universe, the most excellent, the bestower of boons, Hari,

analyzed: parāvarāṇām paramaḥ para apara satām gatiḥ
translated: The supreme of the supreme, the goal of the supreme and the inferior,

analyzed: prabhuḥ pramāṇam mānānām saptaloka guroḥ guruḥ
translated: The lord, the measure of measures, the guru of the guru of the seven worlds,

original: sthitiṃ kartu jagannāthaḥ so 'cintyo garbhatāṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: sthitim kartu jagannāthaḥ saḥ cintyaḥ garbha tām gataḥ
translated: The lord of the world, inconceivable, has entered the womb to establish (the world).

analyzed: prabhuḥ prabhūṇām paramaḥ parāṇām an ādi madhyaḥ bhagavān anantaḥ
translated: The lord of lords, the supreme of the supreme, the beginningless and endless lord,

analyzed: trailokyam aṃśena sanātham ekaḥ kartu mahātmā aditijaḥ
translated: The great soul, the son of Aditi, has descended to make the three worlds with a part of himself a single refuge.

original: na yasya rudro na ca padmayonirnendro na sūryendumarīcimiśrāḥ /
analyzed: na yasya rudraḥ na ca padmayoniḥ na indraḥ na sūrya indu marīci miśrāḥ
translated: O lord of the Daityas, that form of his which neither Rudra, nor the Lotus-born (Brahma), nor Indra, nor the sun, moon, and Marichi,

analyzed: jānanti daitya adhipa yat sva rūpam sa vāsudevaḥ kalayā avatīrṇaḥ
translated: Know, O lord of the Daityas, that Vasudeva, who has descended with a portion (of his own glory),

analyzed: yam akṣaram veda vidaḥ vadanti viśanti yam jñāna vidhūta pāpāḥ
translated: That imperishable one whom the knowers of the Vedas call, into whom the sinless enter by the path of knowledge,

analyzed: yasmin praviṣṭāḥ na purarbhavanti tam vāsudevam praṇamāmi devam
translated: In whom, when entered, cities do not exist, I bow to that God Vasudeva.

analyzed: bhṛtāni aśeṣāṇi yatas bhavanti yathā ūrmayaḥ toyandheḥ ajasram
translated: From whom all things are sustained, as waves from the ocean, and as rays from the sun,

original: layaṃ ca yasmin pralaye prayānti taṃ vāsudevaṃ praṇato 'smyacintyam // / //
analyzed: layam ca yasmin pralaye prayānti tam vāsudevam praṇataḥ smi acintyam
translated: And into whom they all return at the time of dissolution, I bow to that inconceivable Vasudeva.

original: na yasya rūpaṃ na balaṃ prabhāvo na ca pratāpaḥ paramasya puṃsaḥ /
analyzed: na yasya rūpam na balam prabhāvaḥ na ca pratāpaḥ paramasya puṃsaḥ
translated: The form, strength, power, and glory of that Supreme Being,

analyzed: vijñāyate sarva pitāmaha ādyaiḥ tam vāsudevam praṇamāmi nityam
translated: Are not known even by the Grandfather and others; I always bow to that Vasudeva.

original: rūpasya cakṣurgrahaṇe tvageṣā sparśagrahitrī rasanā rasasya /
analyzed: rūpasya cakṣuḥ grahaṇe tvac eṣā sparśa grahitrī rasanā rasasya
translated: The skin is employed in the perception of touch, the tongue in the perception of taste,

original: ghrāṇaṃ ca gandhagrahaṇe niyuktaṃ na ghrāṇacakṣuḥ śravaṇādi tasya // / //
analyzed: ghrāṇam ca gandha grahaṇe niyuktam na ghrāṇa cakṣuḥ śravaṇa ādi tasya
translated: And the nose in the perception of smell; but the nose, eyes, ears, etc. are not employed in the perception of smell, taste, etc.

original: svayaṃprakāśaḥ paramārthato yaḥ sarveśvaro veditavyaḥ sa yuktyā /
analyzed: svayaṃprakāśaḥ paramārthataḥ yaḥ sarveśvaraḥ veditavyaḥ sa yuktyā
translated: That which is self-luminous in reality, the Lord of all, should be known by reasoning.

original: śakyaṃ tamīḍyamanaghaṃ ca devaṃ grāhyaṃ nato 'haṃ harimīśitāram // / //
analyzed: śakyam tam īḍyam anagham ca devam grāhyam nataḥ ham harim īśitāram
translated: I bow to that adorable, sinless God, the Lord Hari, who is to be grasped.

analyzed: yena eka daṃṣṭreṇa samuddhṛtā iyam dharā acalā dhārayati iha sarvam
translated: By whom this immovable earth is lifted up by one tusk and supports everything here,

original: śete grasitvā sakalaṃ jagad yastamīḍyamīśaṃ praṇato 'smi viṣṇum // / //
analyzed: śete grasitvā sakalam jagat yaḥ tam īḍyam īśam praṇataḥ smi viṣṇum
translated: Who lies down after devouring the entire universe, I bow to that adorable Lord Vishnu.

original: aṃśāvatīrṇena ca yena garbhe hṛtāni tejāṃsi mahāsurāṇām /
analyzed: aṃśa avatīrṇena ca yena garbhe hṛtāni tejāṃsi mahā asurāṇām
translated: By whom, having descended in part into the womb, the energies of the great demons were taken away,

original: namāmi taṃ devamanantamīśamaśeṣasaṃsārataroḥ kuṭhāram // / //🔽devo jagadyonirayaṃ mahātmā sa ṣoḍśāṃśena mahāsurendrāḥ /
analyzed: namāmi tam devam anantam īśam aśeṣa saṃsāra taroḥ kuṭhāram  devaḥ jagadyoniḥ ayam mahātmā sa ṣoḍśa aṃśena mahā asura indrāḥ
translated: I bow to that infinite Lord, the axe of the tree of the entire worldly existence.🔽The god, the source of the universe, this great soul, O great demon kings, he entered the womb of the mother of the lord of gods with a sixteenth part,

original: surendramāturjaṭharaṃ praviṣṭo hṛtāni vastena balaṃ vapūṃṣi // / //
analyzed: sura indra mātuḥ jaṭharam praviṣṭaḥ hṛtāni vaḥ tena balam vapūṃṣi
translated: and by him were taken away the strength and bodies.

analyzed: baliḥ uvāca
translated: Bali said:

analyzed: tāta kaḥ yam hariḥ nāma yatas naḥ bhayam āgatam
translated: Father, who is this so-called Hari from whom our fear has come?

analyzed: santi me śataśas daityāḥ vāsudeva bala adhikāḥ
translated: I have hundreds of demons who are stronger than Vasudeva.

analyzed: vipracittiḥ śibiḥ śaṅkuḥ ayaḥ śaṅkuḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Viprachitti, Shibi, Shanku, Ayashanku,

analyzed: haya śirāḥ aśva śirāḥ bhaṅga kāraḥ mahā hanuḥ
translated: Hayashira, Ashashira, Bhangakara, Mahahunu,

analyzed: pratāpī praghaśaḥ śaṃbhuḥ kukkurākṣaḥ ca durjayaḥ
translated: Pratap, Praghasa, Shambhu, and the invincible Kukuraksha,

original: ete cānye ca me santi daiteyā dānavāstathā // / //
analyzed: ete ca anye ca me santi daiteyāḥ dānavāḥ tathā
translated: and there are others like these, the Daityas and Danavas,

analyzed: mahā balāḥ mahā vīryāḥ bhū bhāra dharaṇa kṣamāḥ
translated: who are greatly powerful, greatly valorous, and capable of bearing the burden of the earth.

analyzed: eṣām ekaikaśas kṛṣṇaḥ na vīrya arddhena saṃmitaḥ
translated: Krishna is not equal to even half the prowess of each of them.

analyzed: lomaharṣamaḥ uvāca
translated: Lomaharshana said:

analyzed: pautrasya etat vacaḥ śrutvā prahlādaḥ daitya sattamaḥ
translated: Hearing these words of his grandson, Prahlada, the best of the demons,

analyzed: sa krodhaḥ ca balim prāha vaikuṇṭha ākṣepa vādinam
translated: Angrily spoke to Bali, who had spoken disparagingly of Vaikuntha:

analyzed: vināśam upayāsyanti daityāḥ ye ca api dānavāḥ
translated: The demons and the danavas will meet their destruction,

analyzed: yeṣām tvam īdṛśaḥ rājā durbuddhiḥ avivekavān
translated: Whose king is like you, of evil intentions and poor judgment.

analyzed: devadevam mahābhāgam vāsudevam ajam vibhum
translated: The illustrious Vasudeva, the god of gods, the unborn lord,

analyzed: tvām ṛte pāpa saṅkalpa kaḥ nyaḥ evam vadiṣyati
translated: Except for you, who else with evil intentions would speak like this?

original: ya ete bhavatā proktāḥ samastā daityadānavāḥ /
analyzed: ye ete bhavatā proktāḥ samastāḥ daitya dānavāḥ
translated: All the daityas and danavas that you have mentioned,

analyzed: sa brahmakāḥ tathā devāḥ sthāvara antāḥ vibhūtayaḥ  tvam ca aham ca jagat ca idam sa adri druma nadī vanam
translated: The gods along with Brahma, and all the manifestations down to the immobile beings,🔽You and I, this world with its mountains, trees, rivers and forests,

analyzed: sa samudra dvīpa lokaḥ yam yaḥ ca idam sacarācaram
translated: This world with its oceans and islands, and all that moves and does not move,

analyzed: yasya abhivādya vandyasya vyāpinaḥ paramātmanaḥ
translated: Of whom you are the one to be saluted and worshipped, the all-pervading supreme self,

analyzed: eka aṃśa aṃśa kalā janma kaḥ tam evam pravakṣyati
translated: Who would speak of him in this way, born from a mere fraction of a part,

analyzed: ṛte vināśāḥ bimukham tvām ekam avivekinam
translated: Except for you alone, averse to destruction, lacking discrimination,

analyzed: durbuddhim ajita ātmānam vṛddhānam śāsana atigam
translated: Of evil intentions, unconquered self, old, and disobedient to elders?

original: śocyo 'haṃ yasya me gehe jātastava pitādhamaḥ /
analyzed: śocyaḥ ham yasya me gehe jātaḥ tava pitā adhamaḥ
translated: I am to be pitied, in whose house you, the worst of my sons, have been born,

analyzed: yasya tvam īdṛśaḥ putraḥ devadeva avamānakaḥ
translated: who are such, who insult the gods of gods.

analyzed: tiṣṭhatu aneka saṃsāra saṃghāta ogha vināśini
translated: Let alone the destroyer of the multitude of many births and deaths,

analyzed: kṛṣṇe bhaktiḥ aham tāvat avekṣyaḥ bhavatā na kim
translated: why do you not consider me, who have devotion to Krishna?

analyzed: na me priyataraḥ kṛṣṇāt api dehaḥ yam ātmanaḥ
translated: This body of mine is not dearer to me than Krishna.

analyzed: iti jānāti ayam lokaḥ bhavān ca diti nandana
translated: Thus does this world know, and you, O son of Diti.

analyzed: jānan api priyataram prāṇebhyaḥ pi harim mama  nindām karoṣi tasya tvam akurvan gauravam mama
translated: Even knowing that Hari is dearer to me than my life,🔽you are censuring him, not showing me respect.

analyzed: virocanaḥ tava guruḥ guruḥ tayā api aham bale
translated: O Vṛtra, your guru is my guru, and by him I am also a guru.

analyzed: mama api sarva jagatām guruḥ nārāyaṇaḥ hariḥ
translated: And to me also, Nārāyaṇa Hari is the guru of all the worlds.

analyzed: nindām karoṣi tasmin tvam kṛṣṇe guru guroḥ gurau
translated: You are censuring him, Krishna, the guru of the guru of my guru.

analyzed: yasmāt tasmāt iha eva tvam aiśvaryāt bhrāṃśam eṣyasi
translated: Therefore, from here only you will fall from your prosperity.

analyzed: sa devaḥ jagatām nāthaḥ bale prabhuḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: That god, the lord of the worlds, Janārdana, is the master, O Bali.

analyzed: nanu aham pratyavekṣyaḥ te bhaktimān atra me guruḥ
translated: Am I not to be considered by you? My guru is devoted to him here.

analyzed: etāvat mātram api atra nindatā jagataḥ gurum
translated: By thus censuring the Guru of the world, even to this extent,

analyzed: na apekṣitaḥ tvayā yasmāt tasmāt śāpam dadāmi te
translated: you have not considered me. Therefore, I give you this curse.

analyzed: yathā me śirasaḥ chedāt idam gurutaram bale
translated: As this is more serious for me than the cutting off of my head,

analyzed: tvayā uktam acyuta ākṣepam rājya bhraṣṭaḥ tathā pata
translated: you have spoken thus, slandering Achyuta. Fall down like one who has lost his kingdom.

analyzed: yathā na kṛṣṇāt aparaḥ paritrāṇam bhava arṇave
translated: As there is no other protector in the ocean of worldly existence than Krishna,

analyzed: tathā acireṇa paśyeyam bhavantam rājya vicyutam
translated: may I soon see you fallen from your kingdom.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe saraḥ māhātmye aṣṭamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eighth chapter in the glorious Vamana Purana, describing the greatness of the lake.

analyzed: lomaharṣaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: Lomaharshana said:

analyzed: iti daitya patiḥ śrutvā vacanam raudram apriyam
translated: Thus, having heard the terrible and unpleasant words,

analyzed: prasādayāmāsa gurum praṇipatya punar punar
translated: the lord of the demons repeatedly bowed down and sought the favor of his Guru.

analyzed: baliḥ uvāca
translated: Bali said:

original: prasīda tāta mā kopaṃ kuru mohahate mayi /
analyzed: prasīda tāta mā kopam kuru moha hate mayi
translated: Be appeased, father. Do not be angry with me, who am deluded.

analyzed: bala avalepa mūḍhena mayā etat vākyam īritam  moha apahata vijñānaḥ papaḥ ham ditija uttama
translated: These words were spoken by me, deluded by the intoxication of power.🔽O best of the demons, I am a sinner, my knowledge lost due to delusion.

analyzed: yat śaptaḥ smi durācāraḥ tat sādhu bhavatā kṛtam
translated: It is right that you have cursed me, who am of evil conduct.

analyzed: rājya bhraṃśam yaśaḥ bhraṃśam prapsyāmi iti tatas tu aham
translated: Therefore, I will attain the loss of my kingdom and the loss of my fame.

analyzed: viṣaṇṇaḥ si yathā tāta tathā eva avinaye kṛte
translated: As you are now, so you were when I rebuked you for your want of discipline.

analyzed: trailokya rājyam aiśvaryam anyat vā na ati durlabham
translated: The sovereignty of the three worlds, or any other prosperity, is not very difficult to be obtained.

analyzed: sasāre durlabhāḥ tāta guravaḥ ye bhavadvidhāḥ
translated: But, O child, it is difficult to find in this world preceptors like you.

original: prasīda tāta mā kopaṃ kartumarhasi daityapa /
analyzed: prasīda tāta mā kopam kartum arhasi daityapa
translated: Be pleased, O father, it does not behove you to be angry.

analyzed: tvad kopa paridagdhaḥ ham paritapye divāniśam
translated: I am burning day and night, being consumed by the fire of your anger.

original: prahlāda uvāca🔽vatsa kopena me moho janitastena te mayā /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca  vatsa kopena me mohaḥ janitaḥ tena te mayā
translated: Prahlada said:🔽O child, I was deluded by anger, and therefore I cursed you.

analyzed: śāpaḥ dattaḥ vivekaḥ ca mohena apahṛtaḥ mama
translated: My judgment was clouded by that delusion.

original: yadi mohena me jñānaṃ nākṣiptaṃ syānmahāsura /
analyzed: yadi mohena me jñānam na ākṣiptam syāt mahā asura
translated: If, O great Asura, my knowledge had not been clouded by delusion,

analyzed: tat katham sarvagam jānan harim kaccit śapāmi aham
translated: how could I have cursed Hari, who is all-pervading, knowing as I did?

original: yo yaḥ śāpo mayā datto bhavato 'surapuṅgava /
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ śāpaḥ mayā dattaḥ bhavato sura puṅgava
translated: Whatever curse I have pronounced upon you, O foremost of Asuras,

original: bhāvyametena nūnaṃ te tasmāttvaṃ mā viṣīda vai // / //🔽adyaprabhṛti deveśe bhagavatyacyute harau /
analyzed: bhāvyam etena nūnam te tasmāt tvam mā viṣīda vai  adya prabhṛti deveśe bhagavati acyute harau
translated: it must be fulfilled by you. Therefore, do not grieve.

original: bhavethā bhaktimānīśe sa te trātā bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: bhavethāḥ bhaktimān īśe sa te trātā bhaviṣyati
translated: From this day forth, have firm devotion to the Lord of the gods, to the adorable Achyuta Hari. He will be your protector.

original: śāpaṃ prāpya ca me vīra deveśaḥ saṃsmṛtastvayā /
analyzed: śāpam prāpya ca me vīra deveśaḥ saṃsmṛtaḥ tvayā
translated: O hero, having received my curse, you have remembered the Lord of the gods.

original: tathā tathā vadiṣyāmi śreyastvaṃ prāpsyase yathā // / //
analyzed: tathā tathā vadiṣyāmi śreyaḥ tvam prāpsyase yathā
translated: I shall speak in such a way that you will attain the highest good.

analyzed: lomaharṣaṇaḥ uvāca  aditiḥ varam āsādya sarva kāma samṛddhi dam
translated: Lomaharshana said:🔽Having obtained a boon that fulfills all desires, Aditi

original: krameṇa hyudare devo vṛddhiṃ prāpto mahāyaśāḥ // / //
analyzed: krameṇa hi udare devaḥ vṛddhim prāptaḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: gradually gave birth to the greatly famous god in her womb.

original: tato māse 'tha daśame kāle prasava āgate /
analyzed: tatas māse daśame kāle prasave āgate
translated: Then, in the tenth month, when the time for delivery arrived,

analyzed: ajāyata sa govindaḥ bhagavān vāmana ākṛtiḥ
translated: Govinda, the Lord, was born in a dwarfish form.

analyzed: avatīrṇe jagannāthe tasmin sarva amara īśvare
translated: When that Lord of all gods descended into the world,

analyzed: devāḥ ca mumucuḥ duḥkham devamātā aditiḥ tathā
translated: the gods and Aditi, the mother of the gods, were relieved of their sorrow.

analyzed: vavuḥ vātāḥ sukha spārśāḥ nīrajaskam abhūt nabhaḥ
translated: Winds blew pleasantly, the sky became free from dust,

analyzed: dharme ca sarva bhūtānām tadā matiḥ ajāyata
translated: and all beings developed a tendency towards righteousness.

analyzed: na udvegaḥ ca api abhūt dehe manujānām dvijottamāḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, the bodies of men were not agitated,

analyzed: tadā hi sarva bhūtānām dharme matiḥ ajāyata
translated: and then all beings developed a tendency towards righteousness.

analyzed: tam jāta mātram bhagavān brahma lokapitāmahaḥ
translated: As soon as he was born, the Lord Brahma, the grandfather of the world,

original: jātakarmādikāṃ kṛtvā kriyāṃ tuṣṭāva ca prabhum // / //
analyzed: jātakarma ādikām kṛtvā kriyām tuṣṭāva ca prabhum
translated: performed the birth rites and praised the Lord.

analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

analyzed: jaya adhīśa jaya ajeya jaya viśva guro hare
translated: Be victorious, O Lord of the universe, be victorious, O invincible one, be victorious, O Guru of the universe, O Hari,

analyzed: janma mṛtyu jarā atīta jaya ananta jaya acyuta
translated: Beyond birth, death and old age, be victorious, O infinite one, be victorious, O imperishable one.

analyzed: jaya ajita jaya aśeṣa jaya avyakta sthite jaya
translated: Be victorious, O unconquered one, be victorious, O all-pervading one, be victorious, O one abiding in the unmanifest.

analyzed: paramārtha artha sarvajña jñāna jñeya artha niḥsṛta  jaya aśeṣa jagatsākṣin jagatkartar jagadguro
translated: O one whose purpose is the highest truth, O omniscient one, O one who has emerged from the purpose of knowledge and the knowable,🔽Be victorious, O witness of the entire world, O creator of the world, O teacher of the world.

original: jagato 'jagadanteśa sthitau pālayate jaya // / //🔽jayākhila jayāśeṣa jaya sarvahṛdisthita /
analyzed: jagataḥ jagat anta īśa sthitau pālayate jaya  jaya akhila jaya aśeṣa jaya sarva hṛdisthita
translated: O lord of the beginning and end of the world, be victorious in maintaining the world.🔽Be victorious, O all-pervading one, be victorious, O all-inclusive one, be victorious, O one abiding in everyone's heart.

analyzed: jaya ādi madhya anta maya sarva jñāna maya uttama  mumukṣubhiḥ anirdeśya nitya hṛṣṭa jaya īśvara
translated: Be victorious, O one who is the beginning, middle and end, O supreme one who is full of all knowledge.🔽O one who cannot be described by those who desire liberation, O ever-joyful one, be victorious, O lord.

original: yogibhirmuktikāmaistu damādighuṇabhūṣaṇa // / //🔽jayātisūkṣma durjñeya jaya sthūla jaganmaya /

analyzed: anantām śriyam āpnoti putra pautra samanvitaḥ

analyzed: brahmāvarte naraḥ snātvā brahma jñāna samanvitaḥ

analyzed: tatra snātvā mahā prājñaḥ upavāsa parāyaṇaḥ

analyzed: tatas gaccheta vipra indrāḥ brahmavartam muni stutam

analyzed: tatra abhiṣekam kurvīta pitṛ deva arcane rataḥ

analyzed: aśvamedham avāpnoti pitṛn prīṇāti śāśvatān

analyzed: kāmeśvarasya tīrtham tu snātvā śraddhā samanvitaḥ

analyzed: tatas śītavanam gacchet niyataḥ niyata aśanaḥ
translated: Then one should go to Shitavana, restrained and controlled in diet,

analyzed: tīrtham tatra mahā viprāḥ mahat anyatra durlabham

analyzed: punāti darśanāt eva daṇḍakam ca dvijottamāḥ

translated: having sprinkled the hair there, one becomes purified from sin.🔽There is another excellent tirtha there, the great anushayana,

analyzed: tatra viprāḥ mahā prājñāḥ vidvāṃsaḥ tīrtha tatparāḥ
translated: where very wise and learned Brahmins devoted to tirthas,

analyzed: svanulomāyane tīrthe viprāḥ trailokya viśrute
translated: O best of Brahmins, in the tirtha famous in the three worlds, at anushayana,

analyzed: prāṇāyāmaiḥ niharanti sva lomāni dvijottamāḥ
translated: pluck out their body hair by means of pranayama.

analyzed: pūta ātmānaḥ ca te viprāḥ prayānti paramām gatim

analyzed: tatra snātvā bhakti yuktaḥ tat eva labhate phalam

analyzed: tatas gaccheta śraddhāvān mānuṣam loka viśrutam

translated: In ancient times, black deer afflicted by the hunter's arrows,

analyzed: vigāhya tasmin sarasi mānuṣa tvam upāgatāḥ

original: tato vyādhāśca te sarve tānapṛcchan dvijottamān /

analyzed: asya tīrthasya māhātmyāt mānuṣa tvam upāgatāḥ

analyzed: tatas snātāḥ ca te sarve śuddha dehāḥ divam gatāḥ

analyzed: etat tīrthasya māhātmyam mānuṣasya dvijottamāḥ

analyzed: lomaharṣaṇaḥ uvāca

analyzed: ye prayacchanti viprebhyaḥ teṣām pāpam na vidyate

translated: Those who will perform a funeral ceremony after reaching that river Apaga,

analyzed: asmākam ca kule putraḥ pautraḥ vā api bhaviṣyati

analyzed: tatas gaccheta vipra indrāḥ brahmaṇaḥ sthanam uttamam

analyzed: tatra brahmarṣi kuṇḍeṣu snātasya dvijasattamāḥ
translated: O best of Brahmins, one who bathes in the Brahma-rishi Kundas there,

analyzed: bharadvājaḥ gautamaḥ ca jamadagniḥ ca kaśyapaḥ

on the fourteenth day of the bright fortnight of Chaitra, attains the highest state.

analyzed: asmin muktim avāpnoti darśanāt eva mānavaḥ

analyzed: tatra snātvā arthayitvā ca pitṛ deva gaṇān api
translated: Having bathed there and offered oblations to the ancestors and gods,

analyzed: na durgatim avāpnoti manasā cintitam labhet

analyzed: sarakasya tu pūrveṇa tīrtham trailokya viśrutam
translated: To the east of Saraka is a holy place famous in the three worlds.

analyzed: anya janma su vikhyātam sarva pāpa praṇāśanam

analyzed: nārasiṃham vapuḥ kṛtvā hatvā dānavam ūrjitam
translated: Having assumed the form of Narasimha, he killed the powerful demon.

analyzed: tiryagyonau sthitaḥ viṣṇuḥ siṃheṣu ratim āpnuvan

analyzed: tatas devaḥ mahātmā asau śārabham rūpam āsthitaḥ

analyzed: yuddham ca kārayāmāsa divyam varṣa sahasrakam

original: yudhyamānau tu tau devau patitau saramadhyataḥ // / //
analyzed: yudhyamānau tu tau devau patitau sara madhyatas
translated: While fighting, the two gods fell into the middle of the lake.

analyzed: tasmin saraḥ taṭe vipraḥ devarṣiḥ nāradaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: On the bank of that lake, the celestial sage Narada, the brahmin, was standing.

analyzed: aśvattha vṛkṣam āśritya dhyāna sthaḥ tau dadarśa ha
translated: Resorting to an Asvattha tree, he was in meditation and saw them.

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ catur bhujaḥ jajñe liṅga ākāraḥ śivaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Vishnu was born with four arms, and Shiva remained in the form of a linga.

analyzed: tau dṛṣṭvā tatra puruṣau tuṣṭāva bhakti bhāvitaḥ

analyzed: namaḥ śivāya devāya viṣṇave prabhaviṣṇave
translated: Salutations to Shiva, the god, to Vishnu, the powerful one.

analyzed: haraye ca umā bhartre sthiti kāla bhṛte namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Hari, the husband of Uma, the sustainer of the time of existence.

analyzed: harāya vahu rūpāya viśva rūpāya viṣṇave
translated: To Hara, the multi-formed one, the universe-formed Vishnu,

analyzed: tryambakāya su suddhāya kuṣṇāya jñāna hetave
translated: To Tryambaka, the very pure one, to Krishna, the cause of knowledge.

analyzed: mama āśramam idam puṇyam yuvābhyām vimalīkṛtam

analyzed: adya prabhṛti trailokye anyajanmā iti viśrutam

original: ya ihāgatya snātvā ca pitṝn saṃtarpayiṣyati /

translated: Whoever comes here, bathes, and offers libations to the ancestors,

analyzed: aśvatthasya tu yat mūlam sadā tatra vasāmi aham

analyzed: tatas gaccheta vipra indrāḥ nāgasya hradam uttamam
translated: Then one should go to the excellent lake of the serpent, O best of Brahmins.

analyzed: pauṇḍarīke naraḥ snātvā puṇḍarīka phalam labhet
translated: A man bathing in Paundarika obtains the fruit of Paundarika.

analyzed: mātṛ hā pitṛ hā yaḥ ca brahma hā guru talpa gaḥ

analyzed: devamārga praviṣṭā ca devamārgeṇa niḥsṛta

analyzed: pracī sarasvatī puṇyā api duṣkṛta karmaṇām

analyzed: tri rātram ye kariṣyanti prācīm prāpya sarasvatīm

analyzed: nara nārāyaṇau devau brahmā sthāṇuḥ tathā raviḥ

analyzed: tatra tīrtham auśanam trailokyasya api durlabham

analyzed: evam śukreṇa muninā sevitam tīrtham uttamam

analyzed: ye sevante śraddadhānāḥ te yānti paramām gatim

analyzed: caturmukham brahmatīrtham saraḥ maryādayā sthitam

analyzed: sānnihatya sara utpattim pūraṇam pāṃśunā tatas

analyzed: lomaharṣaṇaḥ uvāca

analyzed: brūhi deva adhidevasya māhātmyam deva tattvataḥ

analyzed: viriñjasya prasādena viditam sarvam eva ca

analyzed: lomaharṣaṇaḥ uvāca

analyzed: paryaṅkam śithilīkṛtvā namaskṛtvā maheśvaram
translated: Loosening his posture, having bowed to Maheshvara,

analyzed: kathayāmāsa tat sarvam yat śrutam brahmaṇaḥ purā

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

translated: Having bowed to Mahadeva, the lord, the giver of boons, the auspicious one,

analyzed: utpatti ca pravakṣyāmi tīrthānām brahma bhāṣitām
translated: I shall describe the origin of the tirthas, as spoken by Brahma.

analyzed: pūrvam ekārṇave ghore naṣṭe sthāvara jaṅgame

analyzed: tasmin aṇḍe sthitaḥ brahmā śayanāya upacakrame

analyzed: sahasra yuga paryantam suptvā sa pratyabudhyata

analyzed: supta utthitaḥ tadā brahmā śūnyam lokam apaśyata

analyzed: sṛṣṭim cintayataḥ tasya rajasā mohitasya ca
translated: For him, who was deluded by rajas while thinking of creation,

analyzed: upasaṃhāra kāle ca tamaḥ gumaḥ pravartate

analyzed: sakalam vyāptam yat kiñcid jīva saṃjñitam

original: sa brahma sa ca govinda īśvaraḥ sa sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: sa brahma sa ca govindaḥ īśvaraḥ sa sanātanaḥ
translated: He is Brahman, He is Govinda, He is the Lord, He is the Eternal.

original: yastaṃ veda mahātmānaṃ sa sarvaṃ veda mokṣavit // / //
analyzed: yaḥ tam veda mahātmānam sa sarvam veda mokṣa vid
translated: One who knows that Great Soul, he knows everything, he knows liberation.

translated: What purpose do they have with all the holy places or hermitages,

analyzed: yeṣām anantakam cittam ātmani eva vyavasthitam

analyzed: tasyām snātaḥ puṇya karmā punāti na ca antarātmā

analyzed: jñeyam tat eva pravadanti santaḥ tat prāpya dehī vijahāti kāmān

analyzed: śīle sthitiḥ daṇḍa vidhāna varjanam akrodhanaḥ ca uparamaḥ kriyābhyaḥ
translated: Abiding in good conduct, avoiding punishment, being free from anger, and refraining from rituals.

original: etad brahma samāsena mayoktaṃ te dvijottama /
analyzed: etat brahma samāsena mayā uktam te dvijottama
translated: O best of brahmins, I have thus briefly told you about Brahman.

analyzed: yat jñātvā brahma paramam prāpsyasi tvam na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: idānīm śṛṇu ca utpattim brahmaṇaḥ paramātmanaḥ

translated: Awakened in those waters, He, knowing the world within,

analyzed: tejasā śoṣitam śeṣam kalala tvam upāgatam

analyzed: yat ādyam niḥsṛtam tejaḥ tasmāt ādityaḥ ucyate

analyzed: aṇḍa madhye samutpannaḥ hrahmā lokapitāmahaḥ

analyzed: ulbam tasya abhavat meruḥ jarāyuḥ parvatāḥ smṛtāḥ

analyzed: garbha udakam samudrāḥ ca tathā nadyaḥ sahasraśas

analyzed: mahat saraḥ tena pūrṇam vimalena vara ambhasā

analyzed: tasmin madhye sthāṇu rūpī vṛṭa vṛkṣaḥ mahā manaḥ

translated: From him emerged the castes - Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas,

analyzed: tatas cintayataḥ sṛṣṭim brahmaṇaḥ vyakta janmanaḥ
translated: Then, as Brahma, born from the unmanifest, was contemplating creation,

analyzed: manasā mānasāḥ jātāḥ sanaka ādyāḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ

analyzed: punar cintayataḥ tasya prajā kāmasya dhīmataḥ

analyzed: utpannāḥ ṛṣayaḥ sapta te prajāpatayaḥ bhavan
translated: the seven sages were born, and they became Prajapatis.

analyzed: punar cintayataḥ tasya rajasā mohitasya ca
translated: Again, as he, deluded by passion, was thinking,

analyzed: te sadā snāna niratāḥ deva arcana parāyaṇāḥ  upavāsaiḥ vrataiḥ tīvraiḥ śoṣayanti kalevaram

analyzed: tatas kālena mahatā umayā saha śaṅkaraḥ
translated: After a long time, Shankara, along with Uma,

original: na dātavyaṃ na yaṣṭavyaṃ na hotavyaṃ kadācana // / //
analyzed: na dātavyam na yaṣṭavyam na hotavyam kadācana
translated: Never should be given, never should be sacrificed, never should be offered.

original: ahameko 'tra vai vandyaḥ pūjyo 'haṃ bhavatāṃ sadā /
analyzed: aham ekaḥ vai vandyaḥ pūjyaḥ ham bhavatām sadā
translated: I alone am to be worshipped here, I am always to be worshipped by you.

original: mayā hi pālitā yūyaṃ nivasadhvaṃ yathāsukham // / //
analyzed: mayā hi pālitāḥ yūyam nivasadhvam yathāsukham
translated: It is by me that you are protected, dwell as you please.

original: tanmatto 'nyo na devo 'sti yuṣmākaṃ yaḥ parāyaṇam /
analyzed: tat mattaḥ nyaḥ na devaḥ sti yuṣmākam yaḥ parāyaṇam
translated: There is no other god than me who is your refuge.

original: etacchratvā tu vacanamṛṣayaḥ sarva eva te // / //
analyzed: etat śratvā tu vacanam ṛṣayaḥ sarve eva te
translated: Having heard these words, all those sages

analyzed: parasparam samāgamya rājānam vākyam abravan
translated: came together and spoke to the king:🔽O king, you are not fit to rule. You are a sinner, a reviler of the Vedas.

original: śrutiḥ pramāṇaṃ dharmasya tato yajñaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: śrutiḥ pramāṇam dharmasya tatas yajñaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: The Vedas are the authority for Dharma, and from them sacrifices are established.

analyzed: yajñaiḥ vinā no prīyante devāḥ svarga nivāsinaḥ
translated: Without sacrifices, the gods residing in heaven are not pleased.

original: aprītā na prayacchanti vṛṣṭiṃ sasyasya vṛddhaye // / //
analyzed: a prītāḥ na prayacchanti vṛṣṭim sasyasya vṛddhaye
translated: When displeased, they do not bestow rain for the growth of crops.

analyzed: tasmāt yajñaiḥ ca devaiḥ ca dhāryate sacarācaram
translated: Therefore, the world of moving and unmoving beings is sustained by sacrifices and gods.

analyzed: etat śrutvā krodha dṛṣṭiḥ venaḥ prāha punar punar
translated: Hearing this, Vena, with eyes of anger, spoke again and again.

analyzed: na yaṣṭavyam na dātavyam iti āha krodha mūrcchitaḥ
translated: Overcome by anger, he said, One should not sacrifice, one should not give.

original: tataḥ krodhasamāviṣṭā ṛṣayaḥ sarva eva te // / //
analyzed: tatas krodha samāviṣṭāḥ ṛṣayaḥ sarve eva te
translated: Then all the sages, possessed by anger,

translated: struck him with sacred grass empowered by mantras and equal to the thunderbolt.

analyzed: tatas tu arājake loke tamasā saṃvṛte tadā
translated: Then, in a world without a king, covered by darkness,

analyzed: dasyubhiḥ pīḍyamānāḥ tān ṛṣīn te śaraṇam yayuḥ
translated: oppressed by bandits, they sought refuge with the sages.

original: tataste ṛṣayaḥ sarve mamanthustasya vai karam // / //
analyzed: tatas te ṛṣayaḥ sarve mamanthuḥ tasya vai karam
translated: Then all the sages churned his right hand.

analyzed: savyam tasmāt samuttasthau puruṣaḥ hrasva darśanaḥ
translated: From it arose a short-sighted man.

analyzed: tam ūcuḥ ṛṣayaḥ sarve niṣīdatu bhavān iti
translated: All the sages said to him, You should sit down.

analyzed: tasmāt niṣādāḥ utpannāḥ vena kalmaṣa saṃbhavāḥ
translated: From him, the Nishadas arose, born from the taint of Vena.

analyzed: tatas te ṛṣayaḥ sarve manmathuḥ dakṣiṇam karam
translated: Then all those sages churned their right hands.

original: mathyamāne kare tasmin utpannaḥ puruṣo 'paraḥ /🔽bṛhatsālapratīkāśo divyalakṣaṇalakṣitaḥ // / //
analyzed: mathyamāne kare tasmin utpannaḥ puruṣaḥ paraḥ  bṛhat sāla pratīkāśaḥ divya lakṣaṇa lakṣitaḥ
translated: When that hand was being churned, another man arose,🔽Resembling a large sala tree, marked with divine characteristics,

analyzed: dhanuḥ bāṇa aṅkita karaḥ caḥ cakra dhva samanvitaḥ
translated: With a bow and arrows in his hand, and holding a discus and flag.

original: tamutpannaṃ tadā dṛṣṭvā sarve devāḥ savāsavāḥ // / //🔽abhyaṣiñcan pṛthivyāṃ taṃ rājānaṃ bhūmipālakam /
analyzed: tam utpannam tadā dṛṣṭvā sarve devāḥ sa vāsavāḥ  abhyaṣiñcan pṛthivyām tam rājānam bhūmipālakam
translated: Seeing him born then, all the gods with Indra,🔽Consecrated him as the king and protector of the earth on earth.

original: tataḥ sa rañjayāmāsa dharmeṇa pṛthivīṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: tatas sa rañjayāmāsa dharmeṇa pṛthivīm tadā
translated: Then he delighted the earth with righteousness,

analyzed: pitrā aparañjitā tasya tena sā paripālitā  tatra rājā itiśabdaḥ sya pṛthivyāḥ rañjanāt abhūt
translated: And his father Paranjita was delighted by him, thus he was protected.🔽There, the word 'raja' (king) came to be for him due to his delighting the earth.

original: sa rājyaṃ pāpya tebhyastu cintayāmāsa pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: sa rājyam pāpya tebhyaḥ tu cintayāmāsa pārthivaḥ
translated: Having obtained the kingdom, the king thought,

analyzed: katham tasya kriyā kāryā para loka sukha āvahā
translated: How should his rites be performed for the happiness of the next world?

analyzed: iti evam cintayānasya nāradaḥ bhyājagāma ha

analyzed: tasmai sa ca āsanam dattvā praṇipatya ca pṛṣṭavān
translated: He offered him a seat and bowing down, asked him,

translated: O Lord, you know the good and bad of all the worlds.

analyzed: pitā mama durācāraḥ deva brāhmaṇa nindakaḥ
translated: My father was of evil conduct, he used to censure gods and Brahmins.

analyzed: sva karma rahitaḥ vipra para lokam avāptavān
translated: O Brahmana, devoid of his own duties, he has attained the other world.

analyzed: tatas bravīt nāradaḥ tam jñātvā divyena cakṣuṣā
translated: Then Narada spoke to him, knowing it through his divine eye,

analyzed: mleccha maghye samutpannam kṣaya kuṣṭha samanvitam
translated: Born in the midst of barbarians, afflicted with consumption and leprosy.

analyzed: tat śrutvā vacanam tasya nāradasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Having heard those words of the great-souled Narada,

analyzed: cintayāmāsa dukha ārtaḥ katham kāryam mayā bhavet
translated: He thought in sorrow, What should I do?

analyzed: iti evam cintayānasya matiḥ jātā mahātmanaḥ
translated: While he was thinking thus, the great-souled one had this thought:

analyzed: putraḥ sa kathyate loke yaḥ pitṝn trāyate bhayāt

translated: Having thought thus, he then asked the sage Narada:

analyzed: tāraṇam mad pituḥ tasya mayā kāryam katham mune

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

analyzed: gaccha tvam tasya tam deham tīrtheṣu kuru nirmalam
translated: Go, purify his body in the holy places,

analyzed: yatra sthāṇoḥ mahat tīrtham saraḥ saṃnihitam prati
translated: Where there is the great holy place of Sthanu, near the lake.

analyzed: etat śratvā tu vacanam nāradasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of the great-souled Narada,

analyzed: sacive rājyam ādhāya rājā sa tu jagāma ha

translated: one afflicted with great leprosy and consumption.

analyzed: tatas śokena mahatā saṃtaptaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: Then, burning with great grief, he spoke these words:

analyzed: ha mlecchāḥ naumi puruṣam sva gṛham ca nayāmi aham

analyzed: tatra aham enam nirujam kariṣye yadi manyatha

analyzed: tathā iti sarve te mlecchāḥ puruṣam tam dayā param

analyzed: ūcuḥ praṇata sarva aṅgāḥ yathā jānāsi tat kuru
translated: They spoke, bending all their limbs, Do as you know.

analyzed: tatas ānīya puruṣān śivikā vāhana ucitān
translated: Then, having brought men suitable for carrying a palanquin,

analyzed: dattvā śulkam ca dviguṇam sukhena nayata dvijam

translated: Having taken him there and lowered him at Sthanu Tīrtha, they left.

analyzed: tatas sa rājā madhyāhne tam snāpayati vai tadā

analyzed: tatas vāyuḥ antarikṣe idam vacanam abravīt
translated: Then the wind in the sky spoke these words:

analyzed: etat śrutvā aduḥkhena mahatā anvitaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of the wind, he was filled with great sorrow.

analyzed: uvāca śoka saṃtaptaḥ tasya duḥkhena duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Afflicted by his sorrow, he spoke, tormented by grief:

analyzed: eṣa ghoreṇa pāpena atīva pariveṣṭitaḥ
translated: He is extremely enveloped by terrible sin.

analyzed: prāyaścittam kariṣye haṃ yat vadiṣyanti devatāḥ

analyzed: tatas tāḥ devatāḥ sarvāḥ idam vacanam abruvan
translated: Then all those gods spoke these words:

analyzed: eṣa sva poṣaṇa paraḥ deva dūṣaṇa tatparaḥ

analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ ca parityaktaḥ na eṣa śuddhi ati karhicit

analyzed: tasmāt enam samuddiśya snātvā tīrtheṣu bhaktitaḥ

analyzed: abhiṣiñcasva toyena tatas pūtaḥ bhaviṣyati

analyzed: iti etat vacanam śrutvā kṛtvā tasya āśramam tatas
translated: Having heard these words, having made his hermitage there,

analyzed: priyaḥ ca sarva sokeṣu deva kārya parāyaṇaḥ

analyzed: tasya evam vartamānasya dharma mārge sthitasya ca

translated: with the passage of time, his mind wavered due to the loss of the wealth of the gods.

analyzed: tena adharmeṇa yuktasya para loka gatasya ca
translated: Due to that unrighteousness, when he went to the next world,

analyzed: tad vākya anantaram jātaḥ śva vai saugandhike vane

translated: Then, after a long time, surrounded by a pack of dogs,

analyzed: paribhūtaḥ saramayā duḥkhena mahatā vṛtaḥ

analyzed: tasmin praviṣṭa mātraḥ tu sthāṇoḥ eva prasādataḥ
translated: As soon as he entered it, by the grace of Sthanu,

analyzed: sa tam pasparśa śanakais sthāṇutīrthe mamañja ha  patataḥ pūrva tīrtheṣu vipruṣaiḥ pariṣiñcataḥ

analyzed: sthāṇutīrthasya māhātmyāt sa putreṇa ca tāritaḥ

analyzed: niyataḥ tad kṣaṇān jātaḥ stutim kartum pracakrame

analyzed: venaḥ uvāca
translated: Vena said:

analyzed: prapadye devam īśānam tvām ajam candra bhūṣaṇam
translated: I take refuge in you, the unborn Lord, the ornament of the moon,

analyzed: mahādevam mahātmānam viśvasya jagataḥ patim

analyzed: namaḥ te devadeveśa sarva śatru niṣūdana
translated: Salutations to you, O Lord of the Lord of gods, the destroyer of all enemies.

analyzed: deveśa bali viṣṭambha deva daityaiḥ ca pūjita

O three-eyed one, thousand-eyed one, three-eyed one, dear to the lord of Yakshas,

analyzed: sarvatas pāṇi pāda anta sarvatas kṣi śiraḥ mukha
translated: With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, head and face everywhere.

analyzed: sarvatas śrutimat loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhasi  śaṅkukarṇa mahā karma kumbhakarṇa arṇava ālaya

analyzed: śata jihva śata āvarta śata udara śata ānana

analyzed: brahmāṇam tvā śatakrato udvaṃśam iva menire
translated: O Shatakratu, they consider you Brahma, like the central beam of a house.

analyzed: mūrtau hi te mahā mūrte samudra ambudharāḥ tathā
translated: In your form, O great form, the oceans and the clouds,

analyzed: devatāḥ sarve eva atra goṣṭhe gāvaḥ iva āsate

translated: In your body, I see Soma, Agni, the lord of waters,

analyzed: nārāyaṇam tathā sūryam brahmāṇam ca bṛhaspatim
translated: Narayana, the sun, Brahma, and Brihaspati.

analyzed: prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ ca eva sat asat ca api daivatam
translated: He is the origin, the dissolution, the existent, and the non-existent, and the deity.

analyzed: namaḥ bhavāya śarvāya vara dāya ugra rūpiṇe
translated: Salutations to Bhava, Sharva, the bestower of boons, the one with a fierce form,

analyzed: andhaka asura hantre ca paśūnām pataye namaḥ  tri jaṭāya tri śīrṣāya tri śulā sakka pāṇaye
translated: and the slayer of the demon Andhaka. Salutations to the lord of beings.🔽To the one with three matted locks, three heads, and a trident in the hand,

original: tryambakāya trinetrāya tripuraghra namo 'stu te // / //🔽namo muṇḍāya caṇḍāya aṇḍāyotpattihetave /
analyzed: tryambakāya trinetrāya tripura ghra namaḥ stu te  namaḥ muṇḍāya caṇḍāya aṇḍāya utpatti hetave
translated: to the three-eyed one, the destroyer of the three cities, salutations to you.🔽Salutations to the shaven-headed one, the fierce one, the one with testicles, the cause of creation,

analyzed: ḍiṇḍima āsakta hastāya ḍiṇḍimuṇḍāya te namaḥ
translated: to the one with hands attached to the drum, to the one with a drum for a head, salutations to you.

analyzed: namaḥ ūrdhva keśa daṃṣṭrāya śuṣkāya vikṛtāya ca
translated: Salutations to the one with upward-streaming hair and fangs, to the dried-up one, the deformed one,

analyzed: dhūmra lohita kṛṣṇāya nīlagrīvāya te namaḥ
translated: to the one with a smoky, red, and black complexion, to the one with a blue neck, salutations to you.

analyzed: namaḥ stu apratirūpāya virupāya śivāya ca
translated: Salutations to the one without a counterpart, to the one with a deformed body, to the auspicious one,

analyzed: sūrya mālāya sūryāya sva rūpa dhvaja māline
translated: Salutations to the sun-garlanded one, to the sun, to the one with the banner of one's own form.

analyzed: namaḥ māna atimānāya namaḥ paṭutarāya te
translated: Salutations to the one beyond pride, salutations to you who are more acute.

analyzed: namaḥ gaṇa indra nāthāya vṛṣa skandhāya dhanvine
translated: Salutations to the lord of the leaders of the Ganas, to the one with shoulders like a bull, to the archer.

analyzed: saṃkrandanāya caṇḍāya parṇa dhāra puṭāya ca
translated: Salutations to the one who roars, to the fierce one, to the one with a cup of leaves.

analyzed: namaḥ hiraṇya varṇāya namaḥ kanaka varcase
translated: Salutations to the one with a golden complexion, salutations to the one with a golden luster.

original: namaḥ stutāya stutyāya stutisthāya namo 'stu te /
analyzed: namaḥ stutāya stutyāya stuti sthāya namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to the praised one, to the one worthy of praise, to the one who abides in praise, salutations to you.

original: sarvāya sarvabhakṣāya sarvabhūtaśarīriṇe // / //🔽namo hotre ca hantre ca sitodagrapatākine /
analyzed: sarvāya sarva bhakṣāya sarva bhūta śarīriṇe  namaḥ hotre ca hantre ca sita udagra patākine
translated: Salutations to the all, to the all-devourer, to the one with the body of all beings.🔽Salutations to the Hotri priest, to the slayer, to the one with a white and lofty banner.

original: namo namyāya namrāya namaḥ kaṭakaṭāya ca // / //
analyzed: namaḥ namyāya namrāya namaḥ kaṭakaṭāya ca
translated: Salutations to the one who should be bowed to, to the humble one, salutations to the one who makes a guttural sound.

analyzed: namaḥ stu kṛśa nāśāya śayitāya utthitāya ca
translated: Salutations to the destroyer of the emaciated, to the one who lies down, to the one who rises up,

analyzed: sthitāya dhāvamānāya muṇḍāya kuṭilāya ca
translated: to the one who stands, to the one who runs, to the shaven-headed one, to the crooked one.

analyzed: namaḥ nartana śīlāya laya vāditra śāline
translated: Salutations to the one who is fond of dancing, to the one who is skilled in playing musical instruments,

analyzed: nāṭya upahāra lubdhāya mukha vāditra śāline
translated: to the one who is greedy for dramatic offerings, to the one who is skilled in playing musical instruments with the mouth.

analyzed: namaḥ jyoṣṭhāya śreṣṭhāya balati bala ghātine
translated: Salutations to the eldest, to the best, to the one who kills the strength of the strong,

analyzed: kāla nāśāya kālāya saṃsāra kṣaya rūpiṇe
translated: to the destroyer of time, to time, to the one whose form is the destruction of the world.

analyzed: himavat duhituḥ kānta bhairavāya namaḥ stu te
translated: O lover of the daughter of the Himalayas, salutations to you, O Bhairava.

original: ugrāya ca namo nityaṃ namo 'stu daśabāhave // / //
analyzed: ugrāya ca namaḥ nityam namaḥ stu daśabāhave
translated: Salutations always to the fierce one, salutations to the one with ten arms.

analyzed: citi bhasma priyāya eva kapāla āsakta pāṇaye
translated: To the one who loves the ashes of consciousness, to the one whose hand is attached to the skull,

analyzed: vibhīṣaṇāya bhīṣmāya bhīma vrata dharāya ca
translated: To the terrifying one, to the fearful one, to the one who upholds terrible vows.

original: namo vikṛtavaktrāya namaḥ pūtogradṛṣṭaye /🔽pakvāmamāṃsalubdhāya tambivīṇāpriyāya ca // / //🔽namo vṛṣāṅkavṛkṣāya govṛṣābhirute namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ vikṛta vaktrāya namaḥ pūta ugra dṛṣṭaye  pakva āma māṃsa lubdhāya tambi vīṇā priyāya ca  namaḥ vṛṣāṅka vṛkṣāya go vṛṣa abhirute namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one with a distorted face, salutations to the one with a pure and fierce gaze.🔽To the one greedy for raw and cooked meat, to the one who loves the tamboura.🔽Salutations to the tree marked with the bull, salutations to the one who is roared at by cows and bulls.

original: kaṭaṅkaṭāya bhīmāya namaḥ paraparāya ca // / //🔽namaḥ sarvavariṣṭhāya varāya varadāyine /
analyzed: kaṭaṅkaṭāya bhīmāya namaḥ paraparāya ca  namaḥ sarva variṣṭhāya varāya vara dāyine
translated: To the terrible one, to the one who is beyond the supreme, salutations.🔽Salutations to the best of all, to the excellent one, to the giver of boons.

analyzed: namaḥ virakta raktāya bhāvanāya akṣa māline
translated: Salutations to the one who is detached and passionate, to the one who holds a rosary of beads.

analyzed: vibheda bheda bhinnāya chāyāyai tapanāya ca
translated: To the one who is divided by the divisions of the distinctions, to the shadow and the sun,

analyzed: aghora ghora rūpāya ghora ghoratarāya ca
translated: To the one whose form is terrible and not terrible, to the one who is more terrible than the terrible.

original: namaḥ śivāya śāntāya namaḥ śāntatamāya ca /
analyzed: namaḥ śivāya śāntāya namaḥ śāntatamāya ca
translated: Salutations to Shiva, to the peaceful one, salutations to the most peaceful one.

analyzed: bahu netra kapālāya eka mūrte namaḥ stu te
translated: To the one with many eyes and skulls, salutations to you, O one with a single form.

analyzed: namaḥ kṣudrāya lubdhāya yajña bhāga priyāya ca
translated: Salutations to the small one, to the greedy one, to the one who loves a share of the sacrifice.

analyzed: pañcālāya sita aṅgāya namaḥ yama niyāmine  namaḥ citra uru ghaṇṭāya ghaṇṭā ghaṇṭa nighaṇṭine
translated: Salutations to the one who is white-bodied, to the one who is bound by the rules of Yama.🔽Salutations to the one with a wonderful large bell, to the one who rings the bell again and again.

analyzed: sahasra śata ghaṇṭāya ghaṇṭā māla vibhūṣiṇe
translated: Salutations to the one with a thousand bells, to the one adorned with a garland of bells.

analyzed: namaḥ kili kili priye
translated: Salutations to the one who is proud of the sound of the bell, to the one who loves the sound of kilikili.

analyzed: huṃhuṅkārāya pārāya huṃhuṅkāra priyāya ca
translated: Salutations to the one who makes the sound hum hum, to the one who is beyond, to the one who loves the sound of hum hum.

analyzed: namaḥ sama same nityam gṛha vṛkṣa niketine
translated: Salutations to the one who is always equal, to the one who resides in houses and trees.

original: garbhamāṃsaśṛgālāya tārakāya tarāya ca // / //🔽namo yajñāya yajine hutāya prahutāya ca /
analyzed: garbha māṃsa śṛgālāya tārakāya tarāya ca  namaḥ yajñāya yajine hutāya prahutāya ca
translated: Salutations to the jackal of the flesh of the womb, to the star, to the protector.🔽Salutations to the sacrifice, to the one who sacrifices, to the one who is offered, to the one who is greatly offered.

analyzed: yajña vāhāya havyāya tapyāya tapanāya ca
translated: Salutations to the one who carries the sacrifice, to the one who is the oblation, to the one who is austerity, to the one who burns.

original: namastu payase tubhyaṃ tuṇḍānāṃ pataye namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ tu payase tubhyam tuṇḍānām pataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the milk, salutations to the lord of the beakless ones.

original: annadāyānnapataye namo nānānnabhojine // / //🔽namaḥ sahasraśīrṣāya sahasracaraṇāya ca /
analyzed: anna dāya annapataye namaḥ nānā anna bhojine  namaḥ sahasra śīrṣāya sahasra caraṇāya ca
translated: Salutations to the giver of food, to the lord of food, to the one who enjoys various foods.🔽Salutations to the one with a thousand heads, to the one with a thousand feet.

analyzed: sahasra udyata śūlāya sahasra ābharaṇāya ca  bāla anucara goptre ca bāla līlā vilāsine
translated: Salutations to the one with a thousand raised spears, to the one with a thousand ornaments.🔽Salutations to the protector of the children who play, to the one who delights in childish play.

original: namo bālāya vṛddhāya kṣubdhāya kṣobhaṇāya ca // / //
analyzed: namaḥ bālāya vṛddhāya kṣubdhāya kṣobhaṇāya ca
translated: Salutations to the child, to the aged, to the agitated, to the agitator.

analyzed: gaṅgā lulita keśāya muñja keśāya vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one whose hair is tossed by the Ganges, to the one with hair like Munja grass.

analyzed: namaḥ ṣaṭkarma tuṣṭāya trikarma niratāya ca
translated: Salutations to the one who is pleased with the six actions and is devoted to the three actions.

analyzed: nagna prāṇāya caṇḍāya kṛśāya sphoṭanāya ca
translated: To the naked one, to the one with life force, to the fierce one, to the thin one, to the one who bursts.

analyzed: dharma artha kāma mokṣāṇām kathyāya kathanāya ca
translated: To the one who should be told about Dharma, wealth, desire and liberation, to the one who tells.

analyzed: sāṅkhyāya sāṅkhya mukhyāya sāṅkhya yoga mukhāya ca
translated: To the one who knows the Sankhya, to the chief of the Sankhyas, to the one whose face is towards the Sankhya Yoga.

analyzed: namaḥ viratha rathyāya catuṣpatha rathāya ca  kuṣṇājina uttarīyāya vyāla yajña upavītine
translated: Salutations to the one who is without a chariot, to the one who is on a chariot on the crossroad.🔽To the one who has a black antelope skin as an upper garment, to the one who has a serpent as a sacred thread.

analyzed: vaktra saṃdhāna keśāya harikeśa namaḥ stu te  tri ambikā ambika nāthāya vyakta vyaktāya vedhase
translated: To the one whose hair is the joining of the faces, to the one with tawny hair, salutations to you.🔽To the lord of the three-eyed one, to the lord of the mother, to the manifest and unmanifest creator.
To the one who desires, to the one who grants desires, to the one who destroys desires, to the one who moves in satisfaction and dissatisfaction.

analyzed: namaḥ sarva da pāpa ghna kalpa saṃkhyā vicāriṇe
translated: Salutations to the all-giving one, to the destroyer of sins, to the one who moves in the number of kalpas.

analyzed: mahāsattva mahā bāho mahā bala namaḥ stu te
translated: To the one of great spirit, to the one with mighty arms, to the one of great strength, salutations to you.

analyzed: mahā megha mahā prakhya mahākāla mahā dhyute
translated: To the great cloud, to the one who shines like a great cloud, to the great dark one, to the one who is greatly radiant.

analyzed: megha āvarta yuga āvarta candra arka pataye namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one who is the lord of the whirlwinds of clouds, of the yugas, of the moon and the sun.

analyzed: tvam annam anna bhoktā ca pakva bhuj pāvana uttama
translated: You are the food, the enjoyer of food, the eater of the cooked, the best purifier.

analyzed: jarāyu ja aṇḍa jāḥ ca eva sveda ja udbhida jāḥ ca ye
translated: To the ones born from wombs, from eggs, from sweat, and from sprouts,

analyzed: tvam eva devadeveśa bhūta grāmaḥ caturvidhaḥ
translated: You alone are the Lord of the gods, and the four types of living beings.

original: sraṣṭā carācarasyāsya pātā hantā tathaiva ca /
analyzed: sraṣṭā carācarasya asya pātā hantā tathā eva ca
translated: You are the creator, protector, and destroyer of this moving and unmoving world.

analyzed: tvām āhuḥ brahya vidvāṃsaḥ brahma brahma vidām gatim
translated: The knowers of Brahman call you Brahman, the goal of those who know Brahman.

analyzed: manasaḥ parama jyotiḥ tvam vāyuḥ jyotiṣām api
translated: You are the supreme light of the mind, and the wind among the luminaries.

analyzed: haṃha vṛkṣe madhukaram āhuḥ tvam brahma vādinaḥ
translated: The expounders of Brahman call you the honey-bee in the tree of the universe.

analyzed: yajuḥ mayaḥ ṛk mayaḥ tvām āhuḥ sāma mayaḥ tathā
translated: They call you the essence of the Yajur Veda, the Rig Veda, and the Sama Veda.

analyzed: paṭhyase stutibhiḥ nityam veda upaniṣadām gaṇaiḥ
translated: You are always praised with hymns and the collections of the Upaniṣads.

original: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyā vaiśyāḥ śūdrā varṇāvarāśca ye /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ vaiśyāḥ śūdrāḥ varṇa avarāḥ ca ye
translated: Brahmins, Kṣatriyas, Vaiśyas, Śūdras, and those of mixed castes,

analyzed: tvam eva megha saṃghāḥ ca vidyutaḥ sa nigarjitam
translated: You are the masses of clouds, lightning, thunder, and the roaring of thunder.

analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ tvam ṛtavaḥ māsaḥ māsa ardham eva ca
translated: You are the year, the seasons, the months, and half-months.

original: yugā nimeṣāḥ kāṣṭhāśca nakṣatrāṇi grahāḥ kalāḥ // / //🔽vṛkṣāṇāṃ kakubho 'si tvaṃ girīṇāṃ himavān giriḥ /
analyzed: yugāḥ nimeṣāḥ kāṣṭhāḥ ca nakṣatrāṇi grahāḥ kalāḥ  vṛkṣāṇām kakubhaḥ si tvam girīṇām himavān giriḥ
translated: You are the yugas, the kṣaṇas, the kāṣṭhas, the lunar mansions, the planets, and the kalās.🔽You are the tops of the trees, and the Himalayas among the mountains.

analyzed: vyāghraḥ mṛgāṇām patatām tārkṣyaḥ nantaḥ ca bhoginām
translated: You are the tiger among animals, Garuḍa among birds, and Ananta among serpents.

analyzed: kṣirā udaḥ syāḥ udadhīnām ca yantrāṇām dhanuḥ eva ca
translated: You are the Milky Ocean among the oceans, and the bow among weapons.

original: vajraṃ praharaṇānāṃ ca vratānāṃ satyameva ca // / //
analyzed: vajram praharaṇānām ca vratānām satyam eva ca
translated: Of weapons, the thunderbolt; of vows, truth;

original: tvameva dveṣa icchā ca rāgo mohaḥ kṣamākṣame /
analyzed: tvam eva dveṣaḥ icchā ca rāgaḥ mohaḥ kṣamā a kṣame
translated: You alone are hatred, desire, attachment, delusion, forgiveness and intolerance,

analyzed: vyavasāyaḥ dhṛtiḥ lobhaḥ kāma krodhau jaya ajayau
translated: Determination, firmness, greed, lust, anger, victory and defeat.

original: tvaṃ śarī tvaṃ gadī cāpi khaṭvāṅgī ca śarāsanī /
analyzed: tvam śarī tvam gadī ca api khaṭvāṅgī ca śarāsanī
translated: You are the body, you are the club-bearer, the holder of the khaṭvāṅga staff and the bow,

original: chettā mettā prahartāsi mantā netā sanātanaḥ // / //
analyzed: chettā mettā prahartā asi mantā netā sanātanaḥ
translated: You are the cutter, the protector, the striker, the thinker, the leader, the eternal one.

analyzed: daśa lakṣaṇa saṃyuktaḥ dharma ūrthaḥ kāmaḥ eva ca
translated: Endowed with ten characteristics, you are Dharma, Artha and Kāma,

original: samudrāḥ sarito gaṅgā parvatāśca sarāṃsi ca // / //
analyzed: samudrāḥ saritaḥ gaṅgā parvatāḥ ca sarāṃsi ca
translated: The oceans, rivers, the Ganges, mountains, lakes,

analyzed: latā vallyaḥ tṛṇa oṣadhyaḥ paśavaḥ mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Creepers, grasses, herbs, animals, birds,
The beginning and end of substances, actions, qualities, time, flowers and fruits,

original: ādiścantaśca vedānāṃ gāyatrī praṇavastathā /🔽lohito harito nīlaḥ kuṣṇaḥ pītaḥ sitastathā // / //
analyzed: ādiḥ ca antaḥ ca vedānām gāyatrī praṇavaḥ tathā  lohitaḥ haritaḥ nīlaḥ kuṣṇaḥ pītaḥ sitaḥ tathā
translated: The beginning and end of the Vedas, Gāyatrī and the Praṇava,🔽Red, green, blue, black, yellow and white,

analyzed: kadruḥ ca kapilaḥ ca eva kapotaḥ mecakaḥ tathā
translated: Kādru, Kapila, the pigeon, the dark-colored one,

analyzed: savarṇaḥ ca api avarṇāḥ ca kartā hartā tvam eva hi
translated: Of the same color and of no color, you alone are the creator and the destroyer.

analyzed: tvam indraḥ ca yamaḥ ca eva varuṇaḥ dhanadaḥ nilaḥ
translated: You are Indra, Yama, Varuṇa, Kubera, and Vāyu,

analyzed: upaplavaḥ citrabhānuḥ svarbhānuḥ eva ca
translated: Upapluta, Chitrabhanu, and Svarbhanu itself.

analyzed: śikṣāhaitram trisauparṇam yajuṣām śatarudriyam
translated: The three Sauparna hymns of the Rig Veda, the Shatarudriya of the Yajur Veda,

original: pavitraṃ ca pavitrāṇāṃ maṅgalānāṃ ca maṅgalam // / //🔽tinduko girijo vṛkṣe mudgaṃ cākhilajīvanam /
analyzed: pavitram ca pavitrāṇām maṅgalānām ca maṅgalam  tindukaḥ giri jaḥ vṛkṣe mudgam ca akhila jīvanam
translated: The most sacred of all sacred things, the most auspicious of all auspicious things...🔽The Tinduka tree, born of the mountains, and the Mudga bean, the life of all beings,

analyzed: prāṇāḥ sattvam rajaḥ ca eva tamaḥ ca pratipad pitiḥ
translated: The vital airs, the qualities of goodness, passion, and darkness, the first lunar day, the lunar mansions...

original: prāṇo 'pānaḥ masānaśca udāno vyāna eva ca /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ u pānaḥ masānaḥ ca udānaḥ vyānaḥ eva ca
translated: The vital airs - Prana, Apana, Samana, Udana, and Vyana,

analyzed: unmeṣaḥ ca nimeṣaḥ ca kṣutam jṛmbhitam eva ca
translated: The opening and closing of the eyes, sneezing, yawning...

analyzed: lohita antargataḥ dṛṣṭiḥ mahā vaktraḥ mahā udaraḥ
translated: The eye with a red tinge, the one with a large mouth and a large belly,

analyzed: śuci romā hari śmaśruḥ ūrdhva keśaḥ cala acalaḥ
translated: The one with clean hair, the tawny-bearded one, the one with upward-streaming hair, the unsteady one...
The one who knows singing, music, and dancing, the one who loves singing, music, and dancing,

original: matsyo jālo jalaukāśca kālaḥ kelikalā kaliḥ // / //
analyzed: matsyaḥ jālaḥ jalaukāḥ ca kālaḥ kelikalā kaliḥ
translated: The fish, the net, the leech, time, play, art, and quarrel...

original: akālaśca vikālaśca duṣkālaḥ kāla eva ca /
analyzed: akālaḥ ca vikālaḥ ca duṣkālaḥ kālaḥ eva ca
translated: The untimely, the improper time, the bad time, and the time itself,

analyzed: mṛtyuḥ ca mṛtyu kartā ca yakṣaḥ yakṣa bhayaṅkaraḥ
translated: The one who is death, the one who causes death, the Yaksha, the one who frightens the Yakshas...

analyzed: saṃvartakaḥ ntakaḥ ca eva saṃvartaka balāhakaḥ
translated: The one who causes dissolution, the destroyer, the one who causes the dissolution of the clouds,

original: ghaṇṭo ghaṇṭī māhaghaṇṭī cirī mālī ca mātaliḥ // / //
analyzed: ghaṇṭaḥ ghaṇṭī māhaghaṇṭī cirī mālī ca mātaliḥ
translated: Ghanta, Ghanti, Maahghanta, Chiri, Mali, and Matali.

analyzed: brahma kāla yama agnīnām daṇḍī muṇḍī tri muṇḍa dhṛk
translated: Holder of the staff of Brahma, Kala, and Agni, with a shaven head and wearing three locks of hair,🔽Holder of the four yugas, the four Vedas, and the initiator of the four sacrificial sessions,

analyzed: cāturāśramya netā ca cāturvarṇya karaḥ tathā
translated: Leader of the four stages of life and the creator of the four social classes,

analyzed: nityam akṣa priyaḥ dhūrtaḥ gaṇādhyakṣaḥ gaṇādhipaḥ
translated: Always fond of gambling, a rogue, the chief of the Ganas, the lord of the Ganas,
Wearing red garlands and garments, a mountain, fond of mountains,

analyzed: śilpam ca śilpinām śreṣṭhaḥ sarva śilpa pravartakaḥ
translated: An artisan, the best of artisans, the initiator of all crafts,
The hook in the eye of Bhaga, fierce, the destroyer of Pushan's teeth,

original: svāhā svadhā vaṣaṭkāro namaskāro namo namaḥ // / //🔽gūḍhavrato guhyatapāstārakāstārakāmayaḥ /
analyzed: svāhā svadhā vaṣaṭkāraḥ namaskāraḥ namaḥ namaḥ  gūḍha vrataḥ guhya tapāḥ tārakāḥ tārakā mayaḥ
translated: The exclamation Svâhâ, Svâhâ, Vashat, Namas, repeated salutations,🔽Of secret vows, of secret austerities, the star, the desire of the stars,

analyzed: dhātā vidhātā saṃdhātā pṛthivyāḥ dharaṇaḥ paraḥ
translated: The supporter, the ordainer, the arranger, another supporter of the earth,

original: brahma tapaśca satyaṃ ca vratacarya mathārjavam /
analyzed: brahma tapaḥ ca satyam ca vrata carya mathā ārjavam
translated: Brahma, penance, truth, vows, conduct, and simplicity,
The soul of beings, the creator of beings, prosperity, the origin of the past, present, and future,

original: bhūrbhuvaḥ svarṛtaṃ caiva dhruvo dānto maheśvaraḥ /
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svarṛtam ca eva dhruvaḥ dāntaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: The earth, the atmosphere, the sky, truth, and also steadiness, self-controlled, Mahesvara,
Initiated, uninitiated, beloved, ill-tamed, born of the tamed,
Moon-whorl, yuga-whorl, dissolving, instigating,
Drop, desire, subtle, gross, fond of a garland of karnikara flowers,

analyzed: nandīmukhaḥ bhīmamukaḥ sumukaḥ durmukhaḥ tathā  hiraṇyagarbhaḥ śakuniḥ mahā uraga patiḥ virāj
translated: Joyful-faced, terrible-faced, well-faced, and ill-faced,🔽Golden womb, bird, lord of great serpents, sovereign,

original: adharmahā mahādevo daṇḍadhāro gaṇotkaṭaḥ /🔽gonarde gopratāraśca govṛṣeśvaravāhanaḥ // / //
analyzed: gonarde gopratāraḥ ca govṛṣa īśvara vāhanaḥ
translated: Destroyer of unrighteousness, great god, wielder of the rod, surpassing the Gaṇas,🔽Gopratāra, the lord of cows and bulls,

original: trailokyagoptā govindo gomārgo mārga eva ca /
analyzed: trailokya goptā govindaḥ gomārgaḥ mārgaḥ eva ca
translated: Protector of the three worlds, Govinda, the path of cows, and the path itself,

original: sthiraḥ śreṣṭhaśca sthāṇuśca vikrośaḥ krośa eva ca // / //🔽durvāraṇo durviṣaho duḥsaho duratikramaḥ /
analyzed: sthiraḥ śreṣṭhaḥ ca sthāṇuḥ ca vikrośaḥ krośaḥ eva ca  durvāraṇaḥ durviṣahaḥ duḥsahaḥ duratikramaḥ
translated: Firm, best, and Sthāṇu, the one who cries out, and the one who is cried out to,🔽Unresistable, unendurable, unendurable, unconquerable,

analyzed: durddharṣaḥ duṣprakāśaḥ ca durdurśaḥ durjayaḥ jayaḥ
translated: Unassailable, unmanifest, unseeable, unconquerable, victorious,

analyzed: śaśāṅka anala śīta uṣṇaḥ kṣudh tṛṣṇā ca nirāmayaḥ
translated: Cool like the moon and hot like fire, hunger and thirst, and free from disease,

analyzed: ādhayaḥ vyādhayaḥ ca eva vyādhi hā vyādhi nāśanaḥ
translated: Afflictions and diseases, and the destroyer of diseases, the remover of diseases,

analyzed: samūhaḥ ca samūhasya hantā devaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: And the destroyer of the host of the host, the eternal god,
Shikhandi, Pundarika-aksha, Pundarika-vana-alaya,

analyzed: tryambakaḥ daṇḍadhāraḥ ca ugradaṃṣṭraḥ kulāntakaḥ
translated: Tryambaka, Danda-dhara, Ugra-danstra, Kula-antaka,

analyzed: viṣa apahaḥ sura śreṣṭhaḥ soma pāḥ tvam marutpate
translated: Visha-apaha, Sura-shreshtha, Soma-pa, Marut-pati,
Amrita-ashi, Jagat-nata, Deva-deva, Ganesha,

analyzed: madhuścyutānām madhupaḥ brahma vāc tvam ghṛta cyutaḥ
translated: Madhu-chyuta, Madhupa, Brahma-vak, Ghrita-chyuta,

analyzed: sarva lokasya bhoktā tvam sarva loka pitāmahaḥ
translated: Bhojta of all worlds, Pitamaha of all worlds,

original: hiraṇyaretāḥ puruṣastvamekaḥ tvaṃ strī pumāṃstvaṃ hi napuṃsakaṃ ca /
analyzed: hiraṇyaretāḥ puruṣaḥ tvam ekaḥ tvam strī pumān tvam hi napuṃsakam ca
translated: Hiranya-reta, Purusha, Eka, Stri, Puma, Napumsaka,

original: bālo yuvā sthaviro devadaṃṣṭrā tvanno girirviśvakṛd viśvahartā // / //
analyzed: bālaḥ yuvā sthaviraḥ deva daṃṣṭrā tvat naḥ giriḥ viśva kṛt viśva hartā
translated: Balu, Yuva, Sthavira, Deva-danstra, Giri, Vishva-krit, Vishva-harta,

original: tvaṃ vai dhātā viśvakṛtāṃ vareṇyas tvāṃ pūjayanti praṇatāḥ sadaiva /
analyzed: tvam vai dhātā viśva kṛtām vareṇyaḥ tvām pūjayanti praṇatāḥ sadā eva
translated: Dhatri, Vishva-krit, Varenya, You are worshipped by those who bow down always,

original: candrādityau cakṣuṣī te bhavān hi tvameva cāgniḥ prapitāmahaśca /
analyzed: candra ādityau cakṣuṣī te bhavān hi tvam eva ca agniḥ prapitāmahaḥ ca
translated: Chandra and Aditya are your eyes, You are Agni and Pra-pitamaha,

original: ārādhya tvāṃ sarakhatīṃ vāglabhante ahorātre nimiṣonmeṣakartā // / //
analyzed: ārādhya tvām sarakhatīm vāc labhante ahorātre nimiṣa unmeṣa kartā
translated: Having propitiated You, the Vedas and speech are obtained, You are the maker of day and night, opening and closing of eyes,

original: na brahmā na ca govindaḥ paurāṇā ṛṣayo na te /
analyzed: na brahmā na ca govindaḥ paurāṇāḥ ṛṣayaḥ na te
translated: Neither Brahma, nor Govinda, nor the ancient sages are like You,

analyzed: māhātmyam veditum śaktāḥ yātātathyena śaṅkara
translated: O Shankara, they are not able to know the greatness truly.

analyzed: puṃsām śata sahasrāṇi yat samāvṛtya tiṣṭhati
translated: The one who stands surrounded by hundreds of thousands of men,

original: mahatastamasaḥ pāre goptā mantā bhavān sadā // / //
analyzed: mahataḥ tamasaḥ pāre goptā mantā bhavān sadā
translated: The protector and observer on the other side of great darkness,

analyzed: yam vinidrāḥ jita śvāsāḥ sattva sthāḥ saṃyata indriyāḥ
translated: The one who is seen by those who are free from sleep, who have conquered breath, who are established in goodness, who have controlled senses,

analyzed: jyotiḥ paśyanti yuñjānāḥ tasmai yoga ātmane namaḥ
translated: The one who is the light, I bow to that one whose nature is yoga.

original: yā mūrtayaśca sūkṣmāste na śakyā yā nidarśitum /
analyzed: yāḥ mūrtayaḥ ca sūkṣmāḥ te na śakyāḥ yāḥ nidarśitum
translated: The subtle forms that cannot be shown,

analyzed: tābhiḥ mām satatam rakṣa pitā putram iva aurasam
translated: Always protect me with those, like a father his own son.

original: rakṣa māṃ rakṣaṇīyo 'haṃ tavānagha namo 'stu te /
analyzed: rakṣa mām rakṣaṇīyaḥ ham tava anagha namaḥ stu te
translated: Protect me, I am to be protected by you, O sinless one, salutations to you.

analyzed: bhakta anukampī bhagavān bhaktaḥ ca aham sadā tvayi
translated: The Lord is compassionate towards devotees, and I am always devoted to you.

analyzed: jaṭine daṇḍine nityam lamba udara śārīriṇe
translated: To the one with matted hair, the one with a staff, the one with a long-bellied body,

analyzed: kamaṇḍalu niṣaṅgāya tasmai rudra ātmane namaḥ
translated: To the one with a water pot and a quiver, salutations to that one whose nature is Rudra.

analyzed: yasya keśeṣu jīmūtāḥ nadyāḥ sarva aṅga sandhiṣu
translated: To the one whose hair is the clouds, whose joints are all the rivers,

analyzed: kukṣau samudraḥ catvāraḥ tasmai toya ātmane namaḥ
translated: Whose belly is the four oceans, salutations to that one whose nature is water.

analyzed: saṃbhakṣya sarva bhūtāni yugānte paryupasthite
translated: At the end of the yuga, when all beings are consumed,

analyzed: yaḥ śete jala madhya sthaḥ tam prapadye mbu śāyinam
translated: I take refuge in the one who lies in the midst of the waters, the one who sleeps in the water.

original: praviśya vadanaṃ rāhoryaḥ somaṃ pibate niśi /
analyzed: praviśya vadanam rāhoḥ yaḥ somam pibate niśi
translated: The one who enters the mouth of Rahu and drinks the moon at night,

analyzed: grasati arkam ca kharbhānuḥ rakṣitaḥ tava tejasā
translated: And swallows the sun and the stars, is protected by your splendor.

original: ye cātra patitā garbhā rudragandhasya rakṣeṇa /
analyzed: ye ca atra patitāḥ garbhāḥ rudra gandhasya rakṣeṇa
translated: And the embryos that fall here, by the protection of Rudra's scent,

analyzed: namaḥ te stu khadhā khāhā prāpnuvanti tat adbhute
translated: To them, O Kha, Kha, Kha, let us offer salutations. They attain that wonder.

analyzed: ye ṅguṣṭha mātrāḥ puruṣāḥ deha sthāḥ sarva dehinām
translated: The beings who are the size of a thumb, residing in the bodies of all embodied beings,

original: rakṣantu te hi māṃ nityaṃ te māmāpyāyayantu vai // / //
analyzed: rakṣantu te hi mām nityam te mām āpyāyayantu vai
translated: May they always protect me, may they always nourish me.

original: ye nadīṣu samudreṣu parvateṣu guhāsu ca /
analyzed: ye nadīṣu samudreṣu parvateṣu guhāsu ca
translated: Those who are in the rivers, oceans, mountains, caves,

analyzed: vṛbha mūleṣu goṣṭheṣu kāntāra gahaneṣu ca
translated: At the roots of trees, in cow pens, and in the dense forests,

analyzed: catuṣpatheṣu rathyāsu catvareṣu sabhāsu ca
translated: At the crossroads, on the streets, in the town squares and assemblies,

analyzed: hasti aśva ratha śālāsu jīrṇa udyāna ālayeṣu ca
translated: In the stables of elephants, horses, and chariots, in the old gardens and abodes,

original: ye ca pañcasu bhūteṣu diśāsu vidiśāsu ca /
analyzed: ye ca pañcasu bhūteṣu diśāsu vidiśāsu ca
translated: And those who are in the five elements, in the directions and intermediate directions,

analyzed: candra arkayoḥ madhya āgatāḥ ye ca candra arka raśmiṣu
translated: Those who are in the middle of the moon and sun, and in the rays of the moon and sun,

original: rasātalagatā ye ca ye ca tasmāt paraṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: rasātala gatāḥ ye ca ye ca tasmāt param gatāḥ
translated: Those who are in the netherworld, and those who are beyond that,

analyzed: namaḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ ca nityaśas
translated: Salutations to them, salutations to them, and salutations to them always.

original: yeṣāṃ na vidyate saṃkhyā pramāṇaṃ rūpameva ca /
analyzed: yeṣām na vidyate saṃkhyā pramāṇam rūpam eva ca
translated: To those who have no number, no measure, and no form,

analyzed: asaṃkhyeya gaṇāḥ rudrāḥ namaḥ tebhyaḥ stu nityaśas
translated: To the Rudras of innumerable hosts, salutations to them always.

original: prasīda mama bhadraṃ te tava bhāvagatasya ca /
analyzed: prasīda mama bhadram te tava bhāva gatasya ca
translated: Be gracious to me, may there be well-being for you and for me who is devoted to you.

original: tvayi me hṛdayaṃ deva tvayi buddhirmatistvayi // / //
analyzed: tvayi me hṛdayam deva tvayi buddhiḥ matiḥ tvayi
translated: My heart is in you, O Lord, my intellect and understanding are in you.

analyzed: stutvā evam sa mahādevam virarāma dvijottmaḥ
translated: Having thus praised the great god, the best of the twice-born ceased.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe saraḥ māhātmye ṣaḍviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-sixth chapter in the glorious Vamana Purana, describing the greatness of the lake.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ
translated: Sanatkumara said:

analyzed: athā enam abravīt devaḥ trailokya adhipatiḥ bhavaḥ
translated: Then the god Bhava, the lord of the three worlds, spoke to him,

analyzed: āśvāsana karam ca asya vākya vid vākyam uttamam
translated: The one who knows speech, the best of speeches, which brings comfort to him.

original: aho tuṣṭo 'smi te rājan stavenānena suvrata /
analyzed: aho tuṣṭaḥ smi te rājan stavena anena suvrata
translated: Oh, I am pleased with you, O king, with this praise, O one of good vows.

analyzed: bahunā atra kim uktena mad samīpe vasiṣyasi
translated: What is the use of speaking much? You will dwell near me.

original: uṣitvā suciraṃ kālaṃ mama gātrodbhavaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: uṣitvā su ciram kālam mama gātra udbhavaḥ punar
translated: Having dwelt for a long time, you will again be born from my body,

analyzed: asuraḥ hi andhakaḥ nāma bhaviṣyasi sura anta kṛt
translated: And will become the demon named Andhaka, the destroyer of the gods.

analyzed: hiraṇyākṣa gṛhe janma prāpya vṛddhim gamiṣyasi
translated: Having obtained birth in the house of Hiranyaksha, you will grow.

analyzed: pūrva adharmeṇa ghoreṇa veda nindā kṛtena ca
translated: Due to the terrible sin committed earlier by denigrating the Vedas,

analyzed: sa abhilāṣaḥ jaganmātuḥ bhaviṣyasi yadā tadā
translated: When you become desirous of the mother of the world,

analyzed: deham śulena hatvā aham pāvayiṣyāmi samārbudam
translated: I will pierce your body with a spear and purify you for a myriad eons.

original: tatrāpyakalmaṣo bhūtvā stutvā māṃ bhaktitaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: tatra api akalmaṣaḥ bhūtvā stutvā mām bhaktitaḥ punar
translated: Even then, becoming sinless, and again worshipping me with devotion,

analyzed: khyātaḥ gaṇa adhipaḥ bhūtvā nāmnā bhṛṅgiriṭiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Becoming known as the lord of the Ganas, remembered by the name Bhṛṅgiriṭi,

original: matsannidhāne sthitvā tvaṃ tataḥ siddhiṃ gamiṣyasi /
analyzed: mad sannidhāne sthitvā tvam tatas siddhim gamiṣyasi
translated: Dwelling in my presence, you will then attain perfection.

original: venaproktaṃ stavamimaṃ kīrtayed yaḥ śṛṇoti ca // / //
analyzed: vena proktam stavam imam kīrtayet yaḥ śṛṇoti ca
translated: One who recites or listens to this hymn spoken by Vena,

analyzed: na aśubham prāpnuyāt kiñcid dīrgham āyuḥ avāpnuyāt
translated: Will not encounter any inauspiciousness and will attain long life.

analyzed: yathā sarveṣu deveṣu viśiṣṭaḥ bhagavān śivaḥ
translated: Just as Lord Śiva is the most distinguished among all gods,

analyzed: tathā stavaḥ variṣṭhaḥ yam stavānām vena nirmitaḥ
translated: Similarly, this hymn composed by Vena is the best of hymns.

analyzed: yaśaḥ rājya sukha aiśvarya dhana mānāya kīrtitaḥ
translated: It is proclaimed for fame, kingdom, happiness, prosperity, wealth, and honor.

original: śrotavyo bhaktimāsthāya vidyākāmaiśca yatnataḥ /🔽vyādhito duḥkhito dīnaścaurarājabhayānvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: śrotavyaḥ bhaktim āsthāya vidyā kāmaiḥ ca yatnataḥ  vyādhitaḥ duḥkhitaḥ dīnaḥ caura rāja bhaya anvitaḥ
translated: It should be listened to with devotion and with effort by those desiring knowledge.🔽One who is sick, suffering, distressed, or afflicted by thieves or kings,

analyzed: rāja kārya vimuktaḥ vā mucyate mahataḥ bhayāt
translated: Or one who is free from royal duties, is freed from great fear.

original: anenaiva tu dehena gaṇānāṃ śreṣṭhatāṃ vrajet // / //
analyzed: anena eva tu dehena gaṇānām śreṣṭha tām vrajet
translated: With this very body, he would attain the best position among the Gaṇas.

original: tejasā yaśasā caiva yukto bhavati nirmalaḥ /
analyzed: tejasā yaśasā ca eva yuktaḥ bhavati nirmalaḥ
translated: He becomes endowed with brilliance, fame, and purity.

original: na rākṣasāḥ piśācā vā na bhūtā na vināyakāḥ // / //
analyzed: na rākṣasāḥ piśācāḥ vā na bhūtāḥ na vināyakāḥ
translated: Neither Rākṣasas, nor Piśācas, nor Bhūtas, nor Vināyakas

original: vighnaṃ kuryurgṛhe tatra yatrāyaṃ paṭhyate stavaḥ /
analyzed: vighnam kuryuḥ gṛhe tatra yatra ayam paṭhyate stavaḥ
translated: Would create obstacles in that house where this hymn is recited.

original: śruṇuyād yā stavaṃ nārī anujñāṃ prāpya bhartṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: śruṇuyāt yā stavam nārī anujñām prāpya bhartṛtaḥ
translated: A woman who listens to this hymn, having obtained permission from her husband,

original: mātṛpakṣe pituḥ pakṣe pūjyā bhavati devavat /
analyzed: mātṛ pakṣe pituḥ pakṣe pūjyā bhavati deva vat
translated: Becomes worshipped like a deity in her mother's family and her father's family.

original: śruṇuyād yaḥ stavaṃ divyaṃ kīrtayed vā samāhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: śruṇuyāt yaḥ stavam divyam kīrtayet vā samāhitaḥ
translated: One who listens to this divine hymn or recites it with concentration,

original: tasya sarvāṇi kāryāṇa siddhiṃ gacchanti nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: tasya sarvāṇi siddhim gacchanti nityaśas
translated: All his undertakings always attain success.

analyzed: manasā cintitam yat ca yat ca vācā anukīrtitam
translated: Whatever is thought in the mind and whatever is recited with speech,

analyzed: sarvam saṃpadyate tasya stavanasya anukīrtanāt
translated: All that is accomplished by reciting this hymn.

analyzed: manasā karmaṇā vācā kṛta menaḥ vinaśyati
translated: The sins committed by thought, deed, or word are destroyed.

original: varaṃ varaya bhadraṃ te yattvayā manasepsitam // / //
analyzed: varam varaya bhadram te yat tvayā manasā īpsitam
translated: Choose a boon, may you be fortunate, whatever is desired by your mind.

analyzed: venaḥ uvāca
translated: Vena said:

original: asya liṅgasya māhātmyāt tathā liṅgasya darśanāt /
analyzed: asya liṅgasya māhātmyāt tathā liṅgasya darśanāt
translated: By the greatness of this Liṅga and by seeing the Liṅga,

analyzed: muktaḥ ham pātakaiḥ sarvaiḥ tava darśanataḥ kila
translated: By seeing you, I am freed from all sins.

original: yadi tuṣṭo 'si me deva yadi deyo varo mama /
analyzed: yadi tuṣṭaḥ si me deva yadi deyaḥ varaḥ mama
translated: If you are pleased with me, O Lord, if a boon is to be given to me,

analyzed: deva sva bhakṣaṇāt jātam śva yonau tava sevakam
translated: I have been born in the womb of a dog due to eating the offerings to you. I am your servant.

analyzed: etasya api prasādam tvam kartum arhasi śaṅkara
translated: O Shankara, it is proper for you to show grace to him also.

analyzed: etasya api bhayāt madhye sarasaḥ ham nimañjitaḥ
translated: It is out of fear for him that I am hiding in the middle of the lake.

analyzed: devaiḥ nivāritaḥ pūrvam tīrthe smin snāna kāraṇāt
translated: I was previously restrained by the gods from bathing in this holy place.

analyzed: ayam kṛta upakāraḥ ca etad arthe vṛṇomi aham
translated: He has rendered this service, and for this purpose I choose him.

original: tasyaitad vacanaṃ śrutvā tuṣṭaḥ provāca śaṅkaraḥ /
analyzed: tasya etat vacanam śrutvā tuṣṭaḥ provāca śaṅkaraḥ
translated: Having heard these words of his, Shankara was pleased and said:

analyzed: bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: He will also be freed from sins, there is no doubt.

analyzed: prasādāt me mahā bāho śiva lokam gamiṣyati
translated: By my grace, O mighty-armed one, he will go to Shiva's world.

analyzed: tathā stavam imam śrutvā mucyate sarva pātakaiḥ
translated: And by hearing this praise, one is freed from all sins.

analyzed: kurukṣetrasya māhātmyam sarasaḥ sya mahīpate
translated: The greatness of Kurukshetra and this lake, O king,

original: mama liṅgasya cotpattiṃ śrutvā pāpaiḥ pramucyate // / //
analyzed: mama liṅgasya ca utpattim śrutvā pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: and by hearing the origin of my linga, one is freed from sins.

analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ uvāca
translated: Sanatkumara said:

analyzed: iti evam uktvā bhagavān sarva loka namaskṛtaḥ
translated: Having said this, the Lord, revered by all the worlds,

analyzed: paśyatām sarva lokānām tatra eva antaradhīyata
translated: disappeared right there, while all the worlds were watching.

original: sa ca śvā tatkṣaṇādeva smṛtvā janma purātanam /
analyzed: sa ca śvā tad kṣaṇāt eva smṛtvā janma purātanam
translated: And that dog, in that very moment, remembering his past birth,

analyzed: divya mūrti dharaḥ bhūtvā tam rājānam upasthitaḥ
translated: assuming a divine form, approached that king.

analyzed: kṛtvā snānam tatas vainyaḥ pitṛ darśana lālasaḥ
translated: Having bathed, Vainya, eager to see his father,

analyzed: sthāṇatīrthe kuṭīm śūnyām dṛṣṭvā śoka samanvitaḥ
translated: seeing the empty hut in Sthanu tirtha, was filled with sorrow.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā venaḥ bravīt vākyam harṣeṇa mahatā anvitaḥ
translated: Seeing this, Vena spoke with great joy,

analyzed: sat putreṇa tvayā vatsa trātaḥ ham naraka ārmavāt
translated: O son, I have been saved from the hell of men by you, my good son.

analyzed: tvayā abhiṣiñcitaḥ nityam tīrtha stha puline sthitaḥ
translated: Always sprinkled by you, I stand on the sandbank in the tirtha.

analyzed: asya sādhoḥ prasādena sthāṇoḥ devasya darśanāt
translated: By the grace of this virtuous one, by seeing the god Sthanu,

original: muktāpāpaśca svarlokaṃ yāsye yatra śivaḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: mukta apāpaḥ ca svar lokam yāsye yatra śivaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: I, being freed from sin, will go to heaven where Shiva resides.

original: ityevamuktvā rājānaṃ pratiṣṭhāpya maheśvaram // / //🔽sthāṇutīrthe yayau siddhiṃ tena putreṇa tāritaḥ /
